originalText.text: I had shoes repaired here and always be completely satisfied but the best were the new handles replacing the original short and uncomfortable ones on my Burberry’s handbag.  The bag looks better than new now! Thank you soooo much. Nice and friendly too, always greeting with a smile.

originalText.text: I do not recommend Express Shoe Repair. They charge much more than their competitors, and they don't get things done when they say they will.

text.text: I do not recommend Express Shoe Repair. They charge much more than their competitors, and they don't get things done when they say they will.

originalText.text:
Truly recommend this place if you need to get your shoes fixed.  The owners are very kind and helpful.  I have gotten my shoes, belts, bags, and watched repair in here.

Recommend this place

text.text:
Truly recommend this place if you need to get your shoes fixed.  The owners are very kind and helpful.  I have gotten my shoes, belts, bags, and watched repair in here.

Recommend this place

originalText.text:
Don’t go here for jewelry repair. I brought in a delicate silver necklace— my favorite, of strong sentimental value. The connecting ring to the equally delicate clasp had broken, but the clasp was fine and I brought it in. Without telling me, they substituted a cheap-looking, ugly, clunky clasp too big for the chain, so that now the clasp always hangs in front. They didn’t return my clasp. And the look and feel of the necklace was ruined.

They should have just told me they didn’t have the right fittings— instead they charged me $50. Which they didn’t mention upfront.

Last week I brought my poor necklace down to the jewelry district and tried again. This time, I got a delicate silver clasp similar to the old one, that doesn’t swing around to the front. It’s lovely…and $25.

Last week I brought my poor necklace down to the jewelry district and tried again. This time, I got a delicate silver clasp similar to the old one, that doesn’t swing around to the front. It’s lovely…and $25.

originalText.text: $55 for sole protectors for pair of shoes- overpriced, it costs $25-38. Everything I did before was also overpriced. It’s close to my place where I live, but will not go there anymore. Usually I’m Ok to pay slightly more for convenience, but not any more.
